Database Questions

  • What are primary keys?
    • This is a unique peice of data that only appears in one database, such as an ID>
  • What are foreign keys?
    • Foreign keys are references to primary keys and only occurs in one database. It is a way of linking the tables together.
  • What is the difference between a tuple and an attribute?
    • An attribute is a collum title and a tuple is a complete row.
  • What is SQL? (What does it stand for and what does it do?)
    • Structured Query Language, or SQL, is the language of databases and allows us to create, chage, delete and retreve data from a database.
  • Provide an example of something that could be use as a primary key (do NOT use the example from the slides) and explain why you chose that.
    • One example of a primary key could be someones cell phone number. Sense most people have different cell phone numbers we could use the cell phone number as a foreign key to talk about peoples address, favorite food or any other personal information.
